name: Slow Cooker 5-Mushroom Barley Soup
author: Doug N
summary: This hearty version of an American classic soup is inspired by 'Chef Jakey' of the long-gone 'Steak Pub' in 1970's Monticello, NY. Long ago, I lived and worked in the upstate New York resort  town of Monticello. As an electrical contractor, one of my clients was an upscale restaurant called 'The Steak Pub.' They had an Asian head chef named 'Jakey.' During winter months when business was slow, we spent hours doing electrical upgrades. Inevitably, we would be there at lunch time, and Jakey would invite us to his specialty, Mushroom Barley Soup, with hot sourdough. The addition of the cream of mushroom soup gives a creamier end result. Serve hot with sourdough or other fine bread, or garlic rounds.
ingredients: ½ cup chopped brown beech mushrooms
¼ cup dried black mushrooms, broken into small pieces
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup  (Optional)
directions: Heat water in a slow cooker set to High until hot; add barley, beef broth, milk, olive oil, onion, celery, carrot, garlic, white mushrooms, brown beech mushrooms, oyster mushrooms, shiitake mushrooms, black mushrooms, cream of mushroom soup, salt, and ground mixed peppercorns to the slow cooker
Cover and cook on High for 1 hour
Remove shiitake mushrooms with a slotted spoon and chop into 1/2-inch pieces
Reduce heat setting to Low and continue cooking 7 hours more
